author: Noemie Bisserbe
title: Takeda Increases Takeover Offer for Drug Rival Shire
text:
Japan’s Takeda Pharmaceutical Co. said Friday it had made a sweetened proposal to buy Shire PLC, just a day after it had a bid rejected for the rival drugmaker that has drawn broader interest across the sector.
The Japanese company proposed £47 a share for Shire, valuing the company at £42.83 billion ($60.3 billion), marginally higher than the £46.50 it offered on Thursday. But at £21 a share in cash and £26 a share in equity, the proposal represented a higher proportion in cash.
